function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of emphasis on pandemic control in non-clinical workplace theory","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on virtual office space without proper management and safety measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate workplace modification practice for pandemic control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious disease spread in the workplace due to lack of effective modification plans and alignment with strategic changes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of alignment between business strategies and workplace modification plans, leading to increased risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent implementation of workplace modification activities, leading to varying levels of risk for contagious disease spread within the organization.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 pandemic on businesses reliant on office workplace","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative impact of social distancing on office atmosphere and employee collaboration","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete understanding of the influence of occupant behavior on air change rate.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimating indoor air pollutant concentrations due to variability in air change rates.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Occupant window-opening behavior affecting air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High air change rates from window-opening behavior","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measuring variability in air change rate due to window-opening behavior","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited studies quantifying the effect of opening windows on the air change rate in homes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hvac system using 100% recirculated air with no fresh air intake","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent opening and closing of windows and doors during experiments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of measurement of outdoor and indoor temperatures and wind speed during air change experiments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collection of wind data at a height of 3.05 m in the backyard only","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Recirculated air in hvac system","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negligible air exchange between adjacent townhouses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Greater temperature range between winter and summer","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation due to air change rate experiments and no noticeable wind","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate temperature measurements","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of wind data during air change rate experiments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of sulfur hexafluoride as a tracer gas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent handling of tracer cylinders between california and virginia houses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of b&k multigas photoacoustic analyzers for measuring sf6 concentration","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential cross-contamination between houses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of air change rate","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air exchange rates in different zones of the house","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive reading of sf6 under clean air conditions and in cases of nonzero residual levels of sf6 in the house","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relatively low standard errors for the calculated air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tracer gas concentration uniformity among and within rooms","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strong stack effect in the virginia house, resulting in uneven tracer gas concentration on each floor","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential reverse stack effect at the virginia house during the summer months","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tracer concentrations exceeding safe levels due to poor mixing and ventilation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tracer gas release leading to uneven distribution and concentration of contaminants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multizone situation created by opening windows allows for the rapid spread of contaminants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different tracer concentrations in multiple compartments can lead to uneven distribution of contaminants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of tracer decay rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overestimation of air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unreliable conclusions on air flow dynamics","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability of air change rates in different seasons","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Bimodal distribution of air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Meteorological parameters affecting air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in air change rate due to window opening width and location.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in establishing a simple relationship between air change rate increases and the width of opening of a single window.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid tracer decay or ’whoosh’ observed after opening a window, leading to a short-lived, significant dilution of existing tracer gas in the immediate air volume.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid clearing out ’whoosh’ effect of tracer gas after window opening","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multiple window opening experiments showing increased air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
